intro: Nanopanax, commonly known as the "little panax," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and clusters of white or greenish flowers. The plant is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Nanopanax species are typically evergreen shrubs or small trees, with some varieties reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and horticultural collections.
